Name: Emma Chen
Journey: Wanted answers about whether life has inherent meaning. Read Camus first, then Dostoevsky, then couldn't stop. Still don't have answers but the questions feel different now.

Name: Marcus Williams
Journey: My girlfriend picks half my books, I pick half of hers. We argue about them constantly. Sometimes I think we stay together because we haven't finished our reading list.

Name: Sophia Patel
Journey: Five of us started a reading group because men in our lit classes wouldn't shut up. Now we only read women writers and it's the best decision we've made.

Name: David Kim
Journey: Divorce lawyer recommended Dostoevsky during my own divorce. Thought it was pretentious advice. Read it anyway. Turns out suffering does make more sense when Russians explain it.

Name: Aisha Thompson
Journey: Watched Pride and Prejudice on repeat during lockdown. Finally read the book. Realized I'd been missing out. Haven't stopped since.

Name: Ryan O'Connor
Journey: Phone died. Guy offered me a book. I was that bored. Turned out Treasure Island is better than I thought books could be.

Name: Isabella Rodriguez
Journey: My mom was bipolar. Read everything about mental illness trying to understand her. Plath and Woolf got closer to the truth than any textbook ever did.

Name: Jake Morrison
Journey: Joined a book club to meet people after moving. Made better friends arguing about 1984 at midnight than I ever did at bars.

Name: Maya Singh
Journey: Every night before bed. Have since I was a kid. My husband leaves me alone for that hour. Non-negotiable.

Name: Ethan Brooks
Journey: Realized I was making films without understanding narrative. Started reading experimental novels. That was sophomore year. Now I read more than I watch movies.

Name: Olivia Martinez
Journey: Lunch breaks. Romance novels only. Fifteen minutes between sessions where nobody needs anything from me.

Name: Nathan Cooper
Journey: Stranded at an airport for eight hours. Only shop open was a bookstore. Bought Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance because it had a motorcycle on the cover. Best impulse buy I ever made.

Name: Zoe Anderson
Journey: Roommate kept laughing while reading. I got curious. Borrowed her book. Now I get it. Never really read before college.

Name: Dr. James Fletcher
Journey: Read to answer philosophical questions that don't have clear answers. Literature does what philosophy papers can'tâ€”makes abstract ideas feel real.

Name: Priya Sharma
Journey: College friends all moved to different cities. Book club keeps us connected. Monthly video calls to argue about characters.

Name: Leo Tanaka
Journey: Roommate bet me twenty bucks I couldn't finish Slaughterhouse-Five. Won the bet, lost my mind a little. Kept reading after that.

Name: Hannah Park
Journey: Seek out novels about art and loss. Trying to understand why objects outlive people. Why preservation matters when everything ends anyway.

Name: Carlos Mendoza
Journey: Commute reading. One hour each way. Started when I got this job. Forty books a year on public transit.

Name: Rachel Green
Journey: Friend gave me The Count of Monte Cristo during a breakdown. Took me months. Those months kept me from quitting.

Name: Dr. Amelia Wright
Journey: Wanted to understand guilt beyond clinical definitions. Specifically sought out Dostoevsky. His characters live with moral complexity diagnosis can't touch.

Name: Sarah Mitchell
Journey: Reading Gothic novels in chronological order. Started with Castle of Otranto. Tracking how horror evolves. Making notes.

Name: Jamal Washington
Journey: My brother and I read the same books. Live eight hundred miles apart. Call each other to discuss. Been doing this since he moved.

Name: Lily Chen
Journey: Bad breakup last year. Read Wuthering Heights because someone said it was toxic. It was. Loved it. Haven't stopped reading since.

Name: Thomas Reed
Journey: Professor said CS majors lack imagination. Got defensive. Read Alice in Wonderland out of spite. Turns out she wasn't completely wrong.

Name: Dr. Jennifer Cole
Journey: Night shifts. 2am, no patients, twenty minutes with a romance novel. Every shift. Reset between traumas.

Name: Alex Zhang
Journey: Quit my job to figure out what mattered. Spent a year reading American classics about success and failure. Those books changed my perspective completely.

Name: Maria Santos
Journey: Mom and I read the same books. Have dinner and talk about them. Only see her twice a month. Books keep us close.

Name: Kevin Park
Journey: Working through every book about consciousness I can find. Kafka, Asimov, Dick. Have a list, checking them off. Trying to understand what makes something alive.

Name: Diana Foster
Journey: School is brutal. Started reading romance novels for something soft. Never been a book person before. This is new.

Name: Benjamin Harris
Journey: Sunday mornings. Coffee and reading. Three hours. Started at thirty. Haven't missed a Sunday since. Wife knows I'm unavailable.

Name: Samantha Lee
Journey: BookTok got me. Bought a book, liked it, kept going. Read thirty books in eighteen months. Didn't see that coming.

Name: Marcus Johnson
Journey: Prep time every morning. Six am, kitchen quiet, forty-five minutes with a book. Been my routine for years.

Name: Rebecca Stone
Journey: Specifically seek out books about injustice and resilience. Not escapism. Education. These books teach what history books can't.

Name: Daniel Chen
Journey: Reading every experimental novel I can find. Analyzing structure, format, rule-breaking. Taking notes for my own work.

Name: Laura Mitchell
Journey: Train commute. One hour each way. Five days a week. Ten hours a week of reading. Finish twenty-five books a year this way.

Name: Christopher Evans
Journey: Read war literature deliberately. Want to understand trauma and memory. Fiction gets at truth differently than facts do.

Name: Vanessa Kim
Journey: Thesis on moral psychology. Reading Russian literature for research. Dostoevsky's characters live with guilt in ways my field can't fully explain.

Name: Ryan Martinez
Journey: Thought reading was boring until I actually tried. On the Road wrecked me. Haven't stopped reading since. Trying to catch up on everything I missed.

Name: Grace Williams
Journey: Monthly book club with coworkers. We pick light stuff. Austen, rom-coms. Mostly it's wine and complaining but the books help.

Name: Tyler Brooks
Journey: Power outage. Three days. Phone died. Found The Old Man and the Sea. Read it by flashlight. Something shifted.

Name: Nicole Anderson
Journey: Seeking literature about solitude and living deliberately. Thoreau, Abbey, Powers. Want to understand alternative ways of being.

Name: Andre Thompson
Journey: Never read until last year. On the Road felt like music. Now I'm chasing that rhythm in everything I read.

Name: Michelle Davis
Journey: Every night before bed. Thirty minutes. Romance novels. Started after my divorce. Can't sleep without reading first.

Name: Steven Park
Journey: Working through adventure classics chronologically. Homer forward. Tracking themes, evolution of the hero's journey.

Name: Jessica Chang
Journey: Reading every dystopian novel ever written. Have a list of fifty. Twenty-two deep. Want to understand how writers imagined technological control.

Name: William Foster
Journey: Heart attack. Started reading to understand mortality. Deliberately chose books about men facing death. Hemingway, Melville.

Name: Amanda Rodriguez
Journey: TikTok convinced me to read Rebecca. Loved it. Now I'm on a Gothic binge. Read more this year than all of high school.

Name: Eric Sullivan
Journey: Partner bet me I couldn't read Dracula on shift. Did it in a week. Got hooked. Started carrying books after that.

Name: Patricia Moore
Journey: Joined my mother's book club at forty. They've been meeting for decades. These women taught me everything. We read, drink wine, tell the truth.

Name: Jonathan Wright
Journey: Reading Victorian Gothic specifically. Wilde, Shelley, Stevenson. Studying how they use horror to explore beauty and decay.
